s.text: There are no guarantees, of course, about how differences will play out, so all you can do is try to look ahead and imagine if you both will adopt the other's ways, carry on comfortably with distinct approaches, or wind up killing each other.
(She's a bad person to have mad at you, by the way.)

(She's a bad person to have mad at you, by the way.)

Using the word "remarkable" bodes well for your future together, as does your understanding of your differences.
I was brought up to make the bed before leaving, but my friends say it is just more work for the maid--who has to strip the sheets anyway.
Most of our (yuppie) friends have their kids call my wife and me by our first names.
